title: Jerusalem's French bookstore goes out of business
description: Faced with growing competition from digital platforms such as Lireka, the Jerusalem bookstore Vice Versa has gone bankrupt.

title: After years of dodging question, DeSantis says 'Of course,' Trump lost the 2020 election
description: Florida Gov. and presidential candidate, Ron DeSantis has shifted his rhetoric as he seeks to reset his stagnant 2024 White House campaign.

title: Paramount announces agreement to sell publisher Simon & Schuster for $1.62 bn
description: The deal, if it goes through, will end a years-long effort to sell the prestigious publishing house – whose authors include Stephen King, Colleen Hoover and Bob Woodward.

title: Trump's countersuit against E. Jean Carroll tossed
description: A federal judge ruled on Monday that Donald Trump can't claim the writer – who won a $5 million judgment against him in May – defamed him by continuing to say she was not only sexually abused but raped.

title: Suspected jihadist attack kills around 20 people in Burkina Faso
description: The Sunday attack in the Centre-East region near the Togolese border also wounded a dozen others.

title: The two women at the forefront of Mexico's presidential primaries
description: On the left, Claudia Sheinbaum, 61, former mayor of Mexico City, dominates the polls for the Morena party. On the right, Xochitl Galvez, 60, a robotics engineer from a rural background, is the most prominent leader of the opposition.

title: France moves to ban far-right party for 'anti-Semitism'
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin announced the dissolution of the far-right, ultra-traditional Catholic party Civitas on Monday, saying he would refer the matter to the prosecutor following the anti-Semitic remarks.

title: New constitution in Central Africa Republic opens door for Touadera's third term
description: The Central African Republic went to the polls at the end of July in a highly anticipated vote on a new constitution, which would remove presidential term limits.

title: Bodies of woman and child found after two ships sink off Italy's Lampedusa island
description: 30 people are missing after the two boats sank off of the Italian island. They left from the Sfax region of Tunisia, a new migratory route that has emerged this year.

title: William Friedkin, Oscar-winning director of 'The French Connection' and The Exorcist,' is dead at 87
description: Friedkin was hailed as a leading member of a new generation of filmmakers.

title: 16 dead, dozens missing in shipwrecks off Tunisia, Western Sahara
description: Migrant deaths have surged in recent years as thousands flee war or crushing poverty, seeking to cross the Mediterranean in the hopes of finding better lives in Europe.

title: Russia to launch lunar mission Friday, its first in nearly 50 years
description: The launch is the first mission of Moscow's new lunar project and comes as President Vladimir Putin looks to strengthen cooperation in space with China.

title: How Bernard Arnault, the world's richest man, is expanding his empire
description: 'LVMH, a state within the state (Part 1/2): The billionaire CEO of the Louis Vuitton Moët-Hennessy group is treated like a head of state. He has become the controversial embodiment of the inversion of the balance of power between politics and business.

title: Paris reports decrease in Airbnb violations
description: The city implemented tough restrictions against the accommodation service, which has been criticized for changing the character of certain city areas.

title: Niger coup: From North to West Africa, voices speak out against ECOWAS military operation
description: The regional organization's ultimatum demanding the junta reinstate President Bazoum expired on Sunday. But there is not unanimous support for the military intervention it threatened.

title: Lieutenant Alain-Fournier's stripes and the dawn of contemporary archeology
description: 'An underground history of France' (12/12). The author of 'Le Grand Meaulnes' was killed in action in 1914. In 1991, his skeleton and those of 20 other soldiers were found in a wood in the village of Saint-Remy-la-Calonne.

title: Russia's relentless punishment of Alexei Navalny
description: The appalling 19-year sentence handed down to Vladimir Putin's main opponent on August 4 fools no one. Justice in Russia has become even more of a caricature of itself since the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Niger: Life goes on in Niamey, despite tense atmosphere and fear of intervention
description: Though their ultimatum expired on Sunday, neighboring countries have not yet acted on the threat of using force. In the meantime, the putschists are working to gather the population's support, and are raising their voice against France.

title: Ireland honored at the Lorient Inter-Celtic Festival
description: The event features a number of bands from the Emerald Isle, including The Kilkennys, who gave their first concert in France.

title: Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, first woman to head the Académie Française, has died
description: The historian, who was the third female member of the institution and elected permanent secretary in 1999, died aged 94.

title: In Hayao Miyazaki's 'My Neighbor Totoro,' raindrops delight a fluffy panda-cat
description: 'The Art of Rain' (Part 2). The Japanese director, whose latest film came out in Japan on July 14, turned a storm and an umbrella into an iconic scene in this animated 1988 masterpiece.

title: 30 dead, 90 injured in Pakistan train derailment
description: The express train was traveling from Karachi to Rawalpindi.

title: The story of Adam and Eve, and how nudity became shameful
description: Why not live naked? For the Judeo-Christian tradition, the answer is found in Genesis: By biting into the forbidden fruit, Adam and Eve distanced themselves from God and became ashamed of their nakedness.

title: Niger closes airspace over 'threat of intervention' as junta defies deadline
description: Western African bloc ECOWAS issued its ultimatum a week ago, threatening to use military action to reinstate deposed president Mohamed Bazoum.

title: Senegal's opposition leader Ousmane Sonko hospitalized a week into prison hunger strike
description: Sonko has been jailed on charges of calling for insurrection and conspiracy against the state.

title: The fires in Rhodes have spared tourism, but not the island's nature
description: The Greek island saw 15% of its land burn between July 18 and 28. While resorts are preparing to reopen, locals feel they have been abandoned – as has the island's nature.

title: Emmanuel Macron was king of the forest. Does anyone care?
description: The French president has been traveling this summer. On July 28, he was halfway around the world for an opportunity to discuss nature and forests with the prime minister of Papua New Guinea.

title: Letters from Olga and Sasha: 'I'm a pacifist, but I can't be one anymore. The war has changed my fundamental nature.'
description: Olga and Sasha Kurovska, two Ukrainian sisters, one living in Paris and the other in Kyiv, kept a diary for a year in 'M Le magazine du Monde.' In it, the 30-somethings give an intimate account of their lives, which have been turned upside down by the war. From now on, they will give news of their daily lives in the form of regular correspondence.

title: Is fog collection the next solution to water shortages?
description: At a time of increasing drought, this technique, inspired by fountain trees, is being used in several countries for agricultural crops or to meet people's water needs.
